items.title: Partnerships/Comm. Prog. Assist.
items.content:
Partnerships/Comm. Prog. Assist. at Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team

Remote | International

Place of Work

  • Flexible – any HOT office (Washington, D.C., New York, Kampala, Dar es Salaam) or Remote working

About HOT

Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team (HOT) is a Washington, D.C. based NGO and global community of thousands of volunteers working together to use maps and open data for humanitarian response and the Sustainable Development Goals. As the world’s preeminent participatory mapping NGO, HOT has fostered a global mapping community composed of more than 100,000 people with ground operations in five countries. When major disaster strikes anywhere in the world, HOT rallies this global network to create the maps and data that enable responders to reach those in need, serving humanitarian partners such as UNHCR, American Red Cross, and MSF.

About the Position Partnerships & Community Programs Assistant

HOT is searching for a Partnerships & Community Programs assistant to join our Partnerships and Community team. The role will involve:

Community responsibilities

  • Coordinate activities for HOT Community programs including the 8 communities benefiting from the HOT Microgrants Program (https://www.hotosm.org/projects/microgrants_and_community_development). Includes assisting with management of: set up of Microgrants program each year, selection of communities to receive grants, monitoring progress through mid-term and end-of-term reports, managing financial disbursements.
  • Monitoring and Evaluation of community grants
  • Set up and manage a Community Volunteer recognition program to provide monthly recognition to active volunteers in the HOT Community
  • Assisting with management of HOT’s monthly Community Webinars program, to share projects and experience across the HOT Community.

Partnerships responsibilities

  • Support management of activities for 3 HOT corporate partners engaging in the Missing Maps program
  • Lead weekly Train the Trainer sessions to help corporate partners begin mapathons
  • Create training resources for partner mapping events as and when needed
  • Monitor impact and create communications for partner’s activities for up to 10 partners
  • Provide support to Global YouthMappers network as needed
  • Occasional conference attendance
  • Administrative support coordinating events and travel
  • Assistance drafting text for donor reports

About You

Our preferred candidate is comfortable working in a very fast paced, startup-like environment with a highly motivated and unconventional team. Whilst significant prior experience is not expected, a pro-active, positive, go-getting nature is essential. You should thrive in an environment where you direct your day-to-day tasks and build a strategy through consensus with a team of staff and volunteers. You can choose your own office location and should love working with remote teams as you’ll spend significant time on the phone, on Slack, and Skype. Essential requirements include:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree
  • Demonstrated experience working in the NGO sector (in a formal role, as a volunteer, or through corporate volunteering/CSR programs)
  • Highly organised and able to manage working across multiple timezones
  • Strong communication skills, including advanced written and spoken English
  • Proven ability to work independently and lead activities
Apply for job

items.title: Genetic Counselor
items.content:
Genetic Counselor at Invitae

Remote

at Invitae

Local (San Francisco Bay Area) or Remote

Invitae is reinventing genetic testing by making genetic testing more affordable and accessible than ever before. We are seeking two board-certified genetic counselors to join our Genetic Counseling Services team in providing remote genetic counseling services to patients. Patient care experience is a requirement, preferably in cancer genetics, cardiac genetics and/or reproductive health. Telegenetics experience is preferred, but not required.

What you will do:

  • Provide genetic counseling (by telephone or video) to patients related to their Invitae test results
  • Communicate with clients, Invitae sales representatives, and other Invitae team members to ensure an optimal provision of patient and client care
  • Assist with development of the Invitae Genetic Counseling Services program and broader Invitae educational efforts

Who you are:

  • Master’s degree in Genetic Counseling from an American Board of Genetic Counseling (ABGC) accredited training program
  • American Board of Genetic Counseling certified
  • Eligible to obtain and maintain Genetic Counselor licensure in multiple states requiring licensure
  • Excellent knowledge base in genetics and patient care
  • Experience in cancer, cardiovascular and/or reproductive health genetics is preferred
  • Creative problem solvers that thrive in flexible, team-oriented environments
  • Ability to function independently in coordination of clinical services and patient care
  • Comfortable in a dynamic environment with evolving needs and progressive workflows
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Self-directed team player

At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Apply for job

items.title: Assistant Creative Producer
items.content:
Effervescent is an award-winning social enterprise that is making the world a kinder and
happier place using creativity, research, and innovation.
We operate and are based at the world’s only contemporary art gallery which is curated
entirely by children and young people. Based in Plymouth, our reach and influence is
becoming increasingly national and international.

Location | Plymouth (with potential for national travel)
Salary | £16-20k FTE (depending on experience and skills) plus annual bonus
0.6 FTE

This is an entry-level creative position in this growing and highly-reputed social impact design
agency.

We are looking for someone who is brilliant at working collaboratively with a team of creative
people and our client groups to achieve outstanding artistic production values.
The Assistant Creative Producer will support us to deliver a range of projects for Effervescent.
1. Production and Creative Project Management assistance:
o Working with partners in statutory and CVS children’s social care, health, youth work
and education agencies or organisations to develop partnership working and co-
delivery. Supporting the development of new partnerships, and supporting existing
partnerships.
o Direct creative delivery with groups of children and young people with significant
mental, social, and health needs relating to early adverse childhood experiences
(assisting the Creative Director and Creative Producers)
o Project and production management; supporting gallery shows including performance
and visual art installation
o Working with the team to ensure budgets are carefully managed and fundraising or
contractual targets are met
o Working with the whole team to ensure communication, marketing and commercial
engagement strategies are designed and implemented
o Supporting and administrating evaluation tasks
o Supporting creative apprentices
2. Support Effervescent’s creative projects including hosting events; blogging; and supporting
development of programmes of work.
Time allocation per year:
Area of Work

Percentage of
Job Role
   
Direct delivery of projects 70.0%
Project development and general/expert support
to other Effervescent projects 15.0%
Team meetings and supervision 10.0%
Research and development / CPD / blogging &
lecturing 5.0%
   
TOTAL 100%

Person Specification

Degree in an arts subject; or three years professional experience in a creative
practice: performance, visual art, media arts, writing, music, filmmaking, graphic
design etc.
Experience of working on professional creative projects from idea to realisation
Experience of health/education/community development/youth/community arts work
or play work OR evidence of substantial training
Demonstrable skills in blogging
Energetic, audacious, curious approach to your work
Strong team player able to prioritise complex workloads
Genuine demonstrable commitment to social justice and social good
Our work is relatively flexible so you will need to be available for some weekends and
evenings, and for school holidays. We have a very definite house style, which is best
described as magical realist. We suggest you research our work before you apply as we will
be looking for someone who can fit the team aesthetically.

More information about Effervescent: www.eff.org.uk
More information about Radiant Gallery: www.radiantspace.org.uk
(both sites are about to be refreshed and combined)

Egencia, and Expedia Group Company, makes business travel better. Combining technology and service, we build a seamless experience, where companies have access to a user-friendly interface, extensive travel options, and 24/7 global support. Join our mission and help us take the next steps in transforming the world of business travel.

Egencia Corporate Virtual Travel Center services both domestic and international reservations. The individuals chosen for this position will have prior travel agent experience, be self-motivated, articulate, with strong interpersonal skills and a proven track record as a team player with the highest level of professionalism.

Who You Are:

  • 5+ years travel industry experience, international experience preferred
  • 3+ years servicing corporate customers with emphasis on booking practices and theory either in a travel office or call center
  • Experience with one or more GDS systems, ability to read, define and apply fare rules, taxes and hub utilization
  • Able to assist in all aspects of arranging/booking travel including, air, rail, hotel, car and alternate ground transportation, including strong aptitude/understanding for booking exchanges, reading and understanding fare rules and applying appropriately when ticketing, processing of a Phase IV
  • First call resolution
  • Strong technical skills, ability to assist and teach customers about online booking tool
  • Able to work well in a virtual structured team environment
  • Capable of prioritizing, multi-tasking and handle high volume effectively
  • Ability to work autonomously and independently, combined with creative problem solving skills
  • Demonstrates a highly professional attitude and personal presentation in all verbal and written communications
  • Flexibility to work any shift (M-F between 7:45am 6pm PST)
  • High School Diploma is required

What You’ll Do:

  • Promote and maintain excellent client relations by managing a prompt and accurate response with positive telephone and service techniques
  • Effectively use all computer systems and tools to ensure consistency and adherence to processes and procedures
  • Proactively recommend to clients efficient and alternate routes, lowest available fares, booking class, exchange rates and travel products/services
  • Research and solve any problems related to reservations
  • Provide priority wait-listing, preferred seat selection, upgrade management as needed
  • Prepare thorough trip itineraries as requested by individual travelers using preferred vendors
  • Act as the first point of contact for the client regarding all travel related inquiries
  • Effectively manage resources and workflow to ensure service guidelines are met and maintained

Why Join Us

Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world’s travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people’s lives better that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.

Whether you’re applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground, so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.

If you are an experienced travel consultant and you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world, then this is the job for you!

Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia, Hotels.com, Expedia Partner Solutions, Egencia, trivago, HomeAway, Orbitz, Travelocity, Wotif, lastminute.com.au, ebookers, CheapTickets, Hotwire, Classic Vacations, Expedia Media Solutions, CarRentals.com, Expedia Local Expert, Expedia CruiseShipCenters, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee’s I-9 to confirm work authorization…..

We're Eduka, an online tutoring company, focused on providing high-quality online education through engaging content, advanced learning technology with highly-skilled and courteous tutors for students in the comfort of their homes or public libraries. Eduka is offering you the chance to become a private tutor and start tutoring jobs at a time and price that suits you.

Whether you're a student looking for tutoring jobs or a professional exploring alternative jobs for teachers, Eduka can cater for everyone. Earn a great living and be your own boss. Offer online tutoring to thousands of potential students all over the globe. Everyone has the skill to teach, so join Eduka, become a private tutor and share your passion!

We are looking for motivated and passionate tutors (both with tutoring experience and without) to teach in a wide range of subjects including:

Mathematics (Early Math, Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Precalculus, Statistics & Probability, Calculus, Multivariable Calculus, Differential equations, Linear algebra,..)
Science (Physics, Chemistry, Organic chemistry, Biology, Food Science, Earth Science,..)
Engineering and Technology (Electrical engineering, Mechanical engineering, Civil engineering, Architecture, Aerospace Engineering, Bioengineering,..)
Computer Science (Computer programming, Computer science, Computer animation, Artificial intelligence, Computer Graphics,.. )
Social science (World history, Modern History, Sociology, Psychology, Philosophy, Classics, Archeology, Anthropology, Education, Geography, Political science, Religion)
Languages (English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Serbian, Russian, Chinese, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish,..)
Economics & finance (Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, Finance & capital markets, Entrepreneurship, Marketing)
Law (Family Law, Criminal Justice, Roman Law, International Law, Constitutional Law, Administrative law, Legal advice)
Medicine (Anatomy, Toxicology, Genetics, Immunology, Epidemics, Embryology, Dermatology, Medical interpretation, and diagnostics,..)
Test preparation

If you have experience in any other additional subject, we would love to hear from you!

With Eduka, you can set your own rates, work from home, tutor online, and connect with thousands of potential students.
Becoming a tutor has never been easier! It is completely free to sign up and start advertising your services today.

The advantages:
Free to register
Set your own rates and schedule. Be your own boss!
Teach online from the comfort of your home
Find thousands of potential students
Convert your knowledge into extra income


Job Responsibilities:
Adheres to the professional teaching obligations and be a subject matter expert.
Fosters a positive and motivating environment for students.
Provide student feedback in a manner that supports learning.
Actively listens and delivers information in a clear, compelling and concise manner.
Ability to multitask between multiple windows, students, and courses.
Engage with students in a friendly and professional manner requesting information about the course, activity, and/or specific content so they can quickly serve the student’s needs.
Respond to student questions in a positive, supportive manner, giving as detailed explanations as possible.
Regular and predictable attendance.

Job Qualifications and Requirements:
You want to pass on your knowledge to new students
You have a school qualification or practical experience or university degree in the subject you wish to teach
You are patient, punctual and a good educator
Reliable, high-speed internet connection and fast computer
Quiet, private, interruption-free room to conduct online tutoring sessions
Ability to be punctual for tutoring sessions is a must
Like us, you think everyone has something special to share

Benefits:
Set your own rates and schedule
We handle all billing and client acquisition, so all you need to think about is how best to help your students.
Flexible schedule: we can potentially offer you as many or as few hours and clients as you'd like. Some of our tutors work just a few hours per week and some work nearly full time.
Free to register
Find thousands of potential students
Convert your knowledge into extra income
Work from your home, cafe or any place with a stable Internet connection from any country across the world

If you're interested in this position, we encourage you to apply. Thank you! Click here to apply!
Please include a short cover letter explaining your skill level of subject or subjects that you want to teach and your interest in or experience working as a tutor.
Please send your CV and cover letter to info@eduka-online-education.com

Eduka is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

HOTH Blogger PRO

Company: The HOTH
Location: Tampa Bay
Job Type: Long-term Job: 5 Techie Writers needed to blog about Web Design, Web Dev., Linux, Cybersecurity, OR Digital Marketing   Anywhere: ContractAnywhereSeptember 12, 2018

Description

Hey. We’re the HOTH.

No, it’s not a Star Wars reference. But points for noticing. It stands for Hittem’ Over the Head - in other words, to bludgeon with awesomeness.

It can be used as a noun (as in our product, or brand), or as a verb (to HOTH someone or HOTH something). And it’s how our clients refer to one of the world’s top SEO companies.

We already run an awesome blog product. But what are we doing now?

GOING PRO!

We’re looking for industry experts that love to create high-quality, niche-specific, badass content.

Do you live and breathe writing and content marketing? Are you an industry expert? Do you have a knack for writing quality, niche content? Can you break down a complicated topic to the layman? Or speak peer-to-peer with experts?

If so, we’d like to chat with you!

Why We’re Awesome to Work With:

  • You’ll strengthen your portfolio
  • Work from wherever you want (as long as we can reach you)
  • There is PLENTY of work to go around, and no cap on what you can write
  • We recognize talent and promote from within
  • Kickass bonuses and incentives
  • Quick, consistent pay

Why We Want to Work With You:

  • You have expert industry knowledge
  • You have experience working under tight deadlines
  • You can grasp complex concepts and make them understandable
  • You have excellent grammar and writing skills
  • You understand that great content marketing is informative, conversational and fun
  • You have a sense of humor
  • You love to write

What Our Writers Have to Say About Working at the HOTH:

Check out our Glass Door reviews.

Interested? Please apply via this link. (Writing samples are required.)

items.content:
Position : Threat Modeling Framework Resource (Only W2)

Location : 100% Remote position(Work from Home)

Duration : 12-24 month contract to hire

Interview: Telephonic round to Hire

Required Skills :

MUST HAVE EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE with one of the following threat modeling frameworks:

-Diamond Model -Cyber Kill Chain -MITRE ATT&CK -MITRE CAPEC Description:

We have a new opportunity for a senior Cyber Security Research Scientist in the Enterprise Information Security , Cyber Threat Management's Enterprise Threat Services (CTM ETS) organization. The individual selected for this position will lead, manage, and support the Enterprise Threat Services mission to architect, design, define, and implement a Threat Modeling Framework, aggregating disparate information from plethora of systems into a quantitative representation of the tangible and intangible risk of the associated threat and attack vectors for Wells Fargo

Required Qualifications

  • 10 + years of cyber threat and vulnerability experience at a global private sector firm or government to manage cyber security risk
  • 5 + years of Information Assurance , and/or Security Operation Center experience
  • 3 + years of implementing and/or enforcing cyber security threat or risk management framework experience

Desired Qualifications

  • Understand, aggregate, and transform disparate information sources from various technology platforms to transpose into measured threat and risk in both qualitative and quantitative output
  • Intimate understanding of Attack Surface Analysis and Threat Modeling
  • Expert knowledge of MITRE ATT&CK Framework and implementation/orchestration/automation
  • Working knowledge of advanced technology platforms that comprise of various InfoSec Controls output/reporting into collective measurement and technical analysis
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Knowledge and understanding of various technologies and security technologies based on NIST 'Defense in Depth' model
  • Knowledge and understanding of business requirements gathering and translation to technical requirements
  • Ability to work effectively, as well as independently, in a team environment
  • Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment
  • Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skills
  • Customer service focus with the ability to respond to requests in a timely manner
  • Ability to present complex material in a digestible, consumable manner to all levels of management
  • Ability to interact with integrity and a high level of professionalism with all levels of team members and management
  • Knowledge and understanding of banking or financial services industry
  • Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
  • Project Management experience managing multiple participants across multiple teams
  • Working knowledge of Atlassian JIRA and/or Confluence

Please let me know if you are comfortable and interested to apply for the above mentioned role.

Please forward your resume to , and you can also reach me at my desk number .

Regards

Mounika.B

Whether you're a student looking for tutoring jobs or a professional exploring alternative jobs for teachers, Eduka can cater for everyone. Earn a great living and be your own boss. Offer online tutoring to thousands of potential students all over the globe. Everyone has the skill to teach, so join Eduka, become a private tutor and share your passion!
We are looking for motivated and passionate tutors (both with tutoring experience and without) to teach in a wide range of subjects including:
Mathematics (Early Math, Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Precalculus, Statistics & Probability, Calculus, Multivariable Calculus, Differential equations, Linear algebra,..)
Science (Physics, Chemistry, Organic chemistry, Biology, Food Science, Earth Science,..)
Engineering and Technology (Electrical engineering, Mechanical engineering, Civil engineering, Architecture and construction, Aerospace Engineering, Bioengineering,..)
Computer Science (Computer programming, Computer science, Computer animation, Artificial intelligence, Computer Graphics,.. )
Social science (World history, Modern History, Sociology, Psychology, Philosophy, Classics, Archeology, Anthropology, Education, Geography, Political science, Religion)
Languages (English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Serbian, Russian, Chinese, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish,..)
Economics & finance (Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, Finance & capital markets, Entrepreneurship, Marketing)
Law (Family Law, Criminal Justice, Roman law, International law, Constitutional law, Administrative law, Legal advice)
Medicine (Anatomy, Toxicology, Genetics, Immunology, Epidemics, Embryology, Dermatology, Medical interpretation, and diagnostics,..)
Test preparation

If you have experience in any other additional subject, we would love to hear from you!
With Eduka, you can set your own rates, work from home, tutor online, and connect with thousands of potential students.
Becoming a tutor has never been easier! It is completely free to sign up and start advertising your services today.

The advantages:
Free to register
Set your own rates and schedule. Be your own boss!
Teach online from the comfort of your home
Find thousands of potential students
Convert your knowledge into extra income


Job Responsibilities:
Adheres to the professional teaching obligations and be a subject matter expert.
Fosters a positive and motivating environment for students.
Provide student feedback in a manner that supports learning.
Actively listens and delivers information in a clear, compelling and concise manner.
Ability to multitask between multiple windows, students, and courses.
Engage with students in a friendly and professional manner requesting information about the course, activity, and/or specific content so they can quickly serve the student’s needs.
Respond to student questions in a positive, supportive manner, giving as detailed explanations as possible.
Regular and predictable attendance.


Job Qualifications and Requirements:
You want to pass on your knowledge to new students
You have a school qualification or practical experience or university degree in the subject you wish to teach
You are patient, punctual and a good educator
Reliable, high-speed internet connection and fast computer
Quiet, private, interruption-free room to conduct online tutoring sessions
Ability to be punctual for tutoring sessions is a must
Like us, you think everyone has something special to share

Benefits:
Set your own rates and schedule
We handle all billing and client acquisition, so all you need to think about is how best to help your students.
Flexible schedule: we can potentially offer you as many or as few hours and clients as you'd like. Some of our tutors work just a few hours per week and some work nearly full time.
Free to register
Find thousands of potential students
Convert your knowledge into extra income
Work from your home, cafe or any place with a stable Internet connection from any country across the world

If you're interested in this position, we encourage you to apply. Thank you! Click here to apply! https://eduka.workable.com/jobs/821727
Please include a short cover letter explaining your skill level of subject or subjects that you want to teach and your interest in or experience working as a tutor.

Eduka is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: Fundraisers / co-workers - to Combat Climate Change
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Fundraisers / co-workers - to Combat Climate Change at ACT Cooperative Corporation AS

Oslo, Remote · Cofounder
Skills
Sales, Social Media Marketing, Sales and Marketing, Communication Skills, Digital Marketing, Crowdfunding
Compensation
No Salary
0.5%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ABOUT ACT
ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking an iOS developer to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking fundraisers to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

We believe that the core problem of global warming is lack of global collaboration. Our goal is to support and enhance global collaboration facilitated by an ecosystem of carefully crafted software systems. Just like Wikipedia is a computer facilitated collaboration platform around building the world’s biggest encyclopedia – so will ACT enable collaboration around green shopping and help humans ACT together for a sustainable planet so that we can do our part to end global warming and also support fair trade.

- ACT is software technology with smart gamification to connect consumers around sustainable shopping and collaboration.
- The immediate goal of ACT is to reduce climate gasses and possibly be the “solution” to global climate change.
- ACT is a role model of a democratic organization: Max factor of 8 between highest and lowest paid, all employees has 1 vote, no person or organization can own voting shares (i.e. no external organization can control ACT, which is important to keep us a partner of independent advice).
- All software is expected to be open source and free, so that all can take action.

We have just finished a major design phase and now wish to start serious development of the software platform. We are looking to tell the world about our extraordinary solution for ACTion, that we believe will change the way we manage global climate change almost overnight.

We need to strengthen our team, our advisory board and council with experienced resources within multiple fields: Management, Communication/journalism/marketing, Financial management, Fundraising, Life cycle analysis & research, Graphical design, Web development, Mobile development, Backend development, Networking.

WHY ACT?
Have you ever thought that it is impossible to solve global climate change and that your effort would mean so little?

What if you had the chance to work with one of the most ambitious climate change projects? We believe that ACT is one of the most hands-on solutions to mitigating climate change. These might sound like just 'great words,' but do the math yourself: E.g. If only 1700 people decided to use ACT to find the least fossil fuel consuming goods, service alternatives and register their purchases it would deliver a combined purchasing power of 63 million USD/year after tax*, which is the same amount Norway uses to conserve the Amazonas rainforest! And those 1700 people could decide to ACT tomorrow!

* Assuming a salary of 37,000 USD/year after tax.

JOB DESCRIPTION, FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS
ACT is now selling shares and applying for funding with various organizations. We need 2 highly motivated FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS to join our Core team in this exciting phase that will have a serious impact on sustainability of our planet.

At best the following requirements apply to you:

- You have applied and won support from Innovasjon Norge on multiple occasions.
- You have applied and won support from various other foundations.
- You have experience from selling shares.
- You have a good network.
- You have a good command of English.

The fundraisers will work closely with co-founders and be a part of our small team of entrepreneurs with a flat organizational structure. Since the company is in an early phase you will be able to shape your role in the company exactly how you like it best.

WORK PLACE
This job should at best be carried out as much as possible in co-location with ACT in Oslo, but we are open to remote work too.

APPLICATION
Please send your CV and some words introducing yourself, why you want to work with ACT, highlight relevant previous experience and your current situation.

For more information about this job and ACT please contact:

Thomas Jepsen
President, Founder & CTO
ACT Cooperative Corporation AS

items.content:
Part-time Online English Teacher - work from home

Company: DaDa

If you are a fun and energetic person, If you love children and teaching, if you are looking forward to start your teaching career in China from your home, come teach with DaDa!

Who We Are

DaDa is an online one-on-one English education platform for children between 4 to 16 years old. We are recruiting part-time English teachers all year round, who can give fun and interactive English classes to our students via video-conference.

  • DaDa is the first online English education company in mainland China to cooperate with the American TESOL Institute.
  • In order to present world class curriculum to our students, we partner with Pearson, Mcgraw-Hill Education, Oxford University Press, National Geographic Learning, Highlights etc.
  • DaDa has raised the equivalent of $100 million USD in C-round financing from Tiger Global Fund and TAL Education Group.

What we offer

  • Up to $22/h
  • Incentives/Bonuses
  • Contract: 6 or 12 month
  • Paid contracted non-teaching hours
  • Working hrs/week Min : 4, Max : 20

Why Choose DaDa

With DaDa, you never have to worry about having an empty schedule. All DaDa Teachers have regular students! This is more than just an online job. DaDa gives you opportunity to gain international working experience. Start your career path in education from the comfort of your home.

Job Requirement:

  • Speak English at an idiomatic level (neutral accent)；
  • Hold a BA degree or above;
  • Stable and strong internet connection;
  • Teaching experienceis preferred;
  • TESOL/TEFL certificationis preferred, or willingness to obtain certification;
  • Will to commit to a regular working schedule for at least 4 hours per week in the following timetable:
  • Monday to Friday：6:00pm-9:10pm (GMT+8 China Standard time)
  • Saturday & Sunday: 10:00am-12:06pm; 2:00pm-4:06pm; 6:00pm-9:10pm (GMT+8 China Standard time)

The benefits for joining us:

  • Work at your convenience, maintain a work-life balance that you always wanted. Spend part-time hours teaching and enjoy life to the fullest.
  • Enjoy the freedom to teach from anywhere in the world, as long as you have a good Internet connection.
  • We provide the teaching material and curriculums from world class publisher
  • Stable income: We will sign a 6 or 12 months contract with fixed teaching time
  • Standby payment. You will get payment in your contract hours even though you don’t have classes.

How to apply:
www.dadaabc.com/go/2975

Remote

You

items.title: Social Media Strategist
items.content:
Social Media Strategist at National Domestic Workers Alliance - NDWA

Remote

Position: Full Time

FLSA Status: Exempt

Reports To: Digital Director

Salary: $55,000 – $60,000, commensurate with experience

Start Date: October or November

Work Location: Remote

Position Summary:

The National Domestic Workers Alliance (NDWA) is the nation’s leading voice for dignity and fairness for the millions of nannies, housecleaners, and caregivers in the United States, most of whom are women. Founded in 2007, we are powered by over 60 affiliate organizations in 36 cities and 17 states. We are organizing for better working conditions and building powerful movements for racial, gender, and economic justice led by women of color, workers, and immigrants.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the National Domestic Workers Alliance accounts on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, potentially other platforms or accounts in future
  • Respond to and engage with supporters and workers on social media, answering questions and providing information
  • Create social media toolkits to help other organizations and individuals amplify our messages, and coordinate with other orgs around social media pushes
  • Organize Twitter chats, Thunderclaps, and other online moments or days of action
  • Create social media graphics in collaboration with NDWA’s design team
  • Create content to help promote the online presence of NDWA’s leaders and spokespeople
  • Write as needed for online ads, video scripts, websites, SMS, and email

Job Requirements:

We’re looking for a great writer who can build and engage our diverse audience of supporters, activists, and domestic workers online — including nannies, house cleaners, and care workers across the country.

Specifically, you should be:

  • A sharp writer, primarily for social media content that engages workers and activists. Digital writing for social media and other online platforms is the focus of this position.
  • A native or fluent Spanish speaker who can write in both languages as well as translate text from Spanish to English and English to Spanish.
  • Metrics-driven and familiar with online metrics and reporting. We have ambitious goals around the numbers of supporters, activists, and domestic workers we’re looking to reach, so you should be comfortable with social media metrics and analytics such as Facebook Insights, Twitter Insights, and Google Analytics, and know how to use them to drive social media strategy and tactics.
  • Skilled at writing for a range of digital mediums. While most of your work will be around social media and online ads, you’ll likely do some writing for SMS, email, and website content.
  • Able to think like a marketer about what will grab our audiences and bring them in.
  • Able to think like an organizer about how we keep our audiences of domestic workers and activists engaged after our initial contact with them, and to engage with our members and activists to understand what drives them.

The ideal candidate has experience managing social media and/or doing online marketing for a nonprofit, campaign, or company. However, we’re open to a range of different backgrounds, so let us know why you think you would be a good fit for this position and what you would bring to it!

Women, People of Color, People with Disabilities and LGBTQ people strongly encouraged to apply. This position will remain open until filled.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Outpatient Coder Validator
items.content:
Senior Outpatient Coder Validator at GeBBS Healthcare Solutions

Remote

Facility Audit

GeBBS Healthcare Solutions, an industry leader in Health Information Management (HIM) and Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) solutions, is seeking highly-motivated individuals with a passion for excellence & collaboration, for careers in the healthcare industry.

Job Title: Remote SR. OP Coder/Validator
Reports To: Manager, Coding & Consulting Services

GeBBS Healthcare Solutions is actively recruiting for the role of a Remote SR. OP Coder/ Validator. We are seeking Full-Time Outpatient coders who will work from their home-based office. This role will begin as soon as qualified candidates are identified.

What you will do:

  • Objectively and accurately conduct coding reviews on medical records for assigned client audit contract in accordance with the statement of work while meeting compliance, productivity and quality expectations.
  • Conduct review of flagged claims and Fraud Waste & Abuse (FWA) referrals involving suspected upcoding, unbundling, anomalous coding, intentional miscoding, etc.
  • Timely review and disposition of suspected case referrals, including determination of inaccurate and/or inappropriate coding.
  • Appropriately refer reviews for clinical validation and communicate with and provide guidance for other Medical Review staff on needed documentation or clarification on coding and/or billing requirements.
  • Enter and update all contract and/or review findings a supporting documentation into the audit processing system.
  • Proof of concept development and data analysis of reports for potential edit development.
  • Monitor CMS and major payer coding and reimbursement policies.
  • Assist in identifying new issues/investigative strategies for audit, perform research to validate new issues, and provide new rules, regulations and applicable Medicare or program language and explanation.
  • Maintain certifications and training required to ensure eligibility to perform audits such as coding certification(s), as well as HIPPA and other compliance training.
  • Notify management of all correspondence indicating displeasure with the Remittance Advice (RA), in the overpayment identification, or in the recovery methods utilized, legal action, or government intervention

Required Skills and Knowledge:

  • Possess knowledge of CMS rules and regulations
  • Proficient in the use of MCS 1500/UB 04 forms
  • Thorough working knowledge of CPT/HCPCs/ICD-9/ICD-10, MS-DRG coding
  • Proven ability to review, analyze, and research coding issues
  • Reimbursement policy and/or claims software analyst experience
  • Familiarity with interpreting electronic medical records (EHR)
  • Basic understanding of accounting principles for accounts payable and receivable as it relates to medical billing
  • Successful completion of GeBBS background screening and hiring process
  • Successful completion of GeBBS screening exam(s) with a passing score
  • Typing skills, comfortable navigating and using desktop technology, as well as working knowledge of MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel).

Education and Experience:

  • Certification as a CPC, CPC-H, CPC-P, RHIA, RHIT, CCS, or CCS-P
  • 3+ years of direct experience in coding/auditing outpatient services, and medical chart review for all provider/claim types for outpatient. Coding for emergency care highly desired.
  • Some inpatient coding/auditing experience for hospital, physician’s office or clinical setting for inpatient services preferred.
  • Prior auditing experience desirable in either a provider setting, or payer experience in claim processing, edit development, and/or coding and reimbursement policy a plus.
  • Previous payer experience in a claim processing, edit development, and/or coding and reimbursement policy a plus.

Why Work at GeBBS?
GeBBS delivers a people-oriented, equal opportunity culture that supports a friendly work environment, innovative ideas, and a benefits-rich employee package.

  • Paid Time Off (PTO) at your Full Pay Rate!
  • Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance
  • AD&D
  • 401K Eligibility
  • GeBBS Computer System supplied!
  • Full IT help available 24/7!

We provide strategic solutions to an expanding customer base of healthcare providers, and medical billing companies. With a current staff of over 4,000 professionals, GeBBS is a 7-time Inc. 5000 honoree as one of the nation’s fastest growing companies.

People are our greatest asset is much more than just an expression to GeBBS. We make every effort to foster an environment where our teams can find an ideal balance between work and fun. Employees at GeBBS believe in being client-centric, open and ethical, innovative, and outcome-driven.

GeBBS is an equal opportunity employer and believes in creating a supportive and diverse workplace. We want to have the best available people in every job. Therefore, the Company does not discriminate and does not permit its employees to discriminate.

Apply for job

items.title: Licensed Professional Counselor Supervisor
items.content:
Licensed Professional Counselor Supervisor at Lionrock Recovery

Remote | Part-time

With AOD Experience
Washington, DC
Part-Time
Clinical Operations
Experienced

Description
We Need State Licensed LCSW, LMFT, LPC, and LADC Clinicians with Substance Abuse Experience for Telehealth IOP and OP. Must have at least a Master’s Degree. You can work from home and assist men and women recover from drugs and alcohol. You must be FULLY licensed.

About Us
Lionrock Recovery (www.lionrockrecovery.com) is a Joint Commission-accredited telehealth company providing treatment for substance use disorders based in Silicon Valley, provides tele-counseling services to clients in an online intensive outpatient/outpatient substance use disorder treatment program. Responsible for the provision of full range of substance use disorder outpatient treatment services from comprehensive assessment, treatment planning, supportive counseling and case management as well as aftercare planning, individual psychotherapy, and crisis evaluation and support. Accepts new clients in-state as assigned by the Lionrock admissions department, with a commitment to follow through with client treatment from admission to discharge. Because this is online treatment, you must have experience using a computer for your work. Google Doc familiarity, Spreadsheets, Documentation, & Secure Email. Primary Duties and Responsibilities (via video conferencing and electronic medical records).

  • Must complete and maintain accurate records or reports regarding the patients’ histories and progress, services provided, and all per Lionrock’s mission and guidelines.
  • Provides a full range of supportive SUD services including brief individual counseling, intensive counseling, case management, and consultations to support strength-based discharge planning and continuity of care.
  • Participates in case conferencing with clinical supervisor and director to assess client needs, progress, documentation, and exit planning.
  • Prepares all related treatment documentation in accordance with applicable organizational and state standards in a clear, thorough, and timely manner. Experience with electronic health records essential.
  • Intervenes as an advocate for clients to resolve emergency problems in crisis situations. Provide client and/or family members with information about addiction issues and about available services or programs, making appropriate referrals when necessary.
  • Communicating with service providers outside of the organization to market, refer, and collaborate enhancing client care.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in a mental health related field such as Psychology, Counseling, Social Work, Marriage and Family Counseling with coursework and experience in the treatment of substance use disorders. Must have licensure that allows for the counselor to assist clients unsupervised.
  • State licensure as a Clinical Mental Health Social Worker, Professional counselor, or MFT. Certification as an Alcohol & Drug Counselor (if claiming license eligibility, the applicant must be able to provide proper documentation). Two (2) year licensed experience providing SUD services in an inpatient or outpatient setting is preferred.
  • Ability to work in crisis situations in a professional and mature manner.
  • Strong counseling, CBT, and motivational interviewing skills. Ability to apply evidence-based therapeutic interventions as well as an understanding of traditional community supports in substance use disorder treatment essential.
  • Must be able to work individually and in a team environment. High degree of time management skill desired.
  • Must be available to schedule client video tele-counseling sessions in a private office space. Home offices are acceptable provided that clinicians represent the agency in a professional manner.
  • Above average verbal and writing skills essential as most company and client communication is completed via email.
  • Must be able to develop clear and concise reports in a timely manner. Experience with Electronic Medical Records desired.
  • Strong ability to work with computers and software desired. Must agree to maintain computer and internet access as these are essential to providing online counseling services.

$40 per hour – Part-time

Apply for job

items.title: Course Instructor I, Nursing
items.content:
Course Instructor I, Nursing at Western Governors University

Remote

Job Description

Student learning is the primary responsibility of WGU faculty. Course Instructors are subject matter experts who teach and mentor students when students engage in their assigned courses. Course Instructors vary the type, length, and intensity of instructional method based upon student needs. Course Instructors work on a team to support an assigned group of students and offer specialized instruction on challenging topics. Using technology, Course Instructors interact with students in both group and one-on-one settings. As part of WGU’s disaggregated faculty model, Course Instructors provide their expertise and collaborate with the faculty who are responsible for developing and evaluating courses and assessments.

Required Skills

  • Acts as a steward for carrying out WGU’s mission and strategic vision. The Course Instructor must demonstrate a high level of commitment effectively and consistently.
  • Provides expertise in assigned content area and maintains current knowledge in his/her field.
  • Fosters student learning through innovative teaching practices.
  • Responds with urgency to meet student needs and communicates professionally and respectfully with students and all other members of the WGU community.
  • Offers proactive support and outreach to assigned students.
  • Uses technology-based teaching and communication platforms to aid students in the development of competencies.
  • Collaborates with other professionals within the university to promote a positive, student-obsessed atmosphere.
  • Participates and or leads training activities;
  • Responds with urgency to changing requirements, priorities, and short deadlines.
  • Consistently exhibits WGU Leadership Principles.

Required Experience

  • Doctorate, or terminal degree in a specific content area. Education must be from an accredited institution. Education is verified.
  • Must have a Masters Degree in Nursing.
  • Must have an active and unencumbered nursing license.
  • Separate qualifications and/or licensure may be required for some degree programs.
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience providing student support and instruction; demonstrated ability to work with at-risk learners.

  • Extraordinary customer service and communication skills.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with ability to present information clearly, concisely, and accurately; friendly, persuasive speaking and writing style.
  • Well organized – conscientious and thorough with detail.

WORK FROM HOME, United States

Full-Time/Regular

items.title: U.S. English Linguist
items.content:
U.S. English Linguist at Appen

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Appen is looking for remote, independent contractor linguists to annotate data for our client’s Natural Language Processing systems.

You know that language data is the underpinning of all current language technologies. You love practical language analysis as well as theoretical. You’re quick to learn and implement new label sets with a consideration for the purpose of the data. You’re willing and able to spend several hours a day focusing on your task, with consistent results.

This is an ideal position for graduate students or anyone looking for flexible work; the roles are part-time at 20 hrs weekly and the project is expected to continue through the calendar year. All positions are remote.

The successful candidate will be engaged in the following responsibilities:

  • Annotate language data with linguistic information
  • Implement annotation conventions and guidelines with accuracy and consistency
  • Communicate with other annotators about effective annotation strategies
  • Contribute to the improvement of tools and processes by raising issues and suggesting improvements
  • Understand and adapt to changing requirements

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in Linguistics, Computational Linguistics, Language Technologies, or related field
  • Interest in practical as well as theoretical linguistics, especially syntax, semantics, and pragmatics
  • Facility with computers and software applications
  • Ability to adapt to changing requirements, priorities, and revisions
  • Cooperative, solution-oriented attitude
  • Eagerness to learn new skills and work quickly
  • Enthusiasm for detail work
  • Ability to focus for significant portions of the work day
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically
  • Candidates should be native US English speakers or if they are near-natives, have lived in the US for a minimum of three years to fulfill the client’s language requirement.
  • All positions are remote but the candidates must reside and be legally allowed to work in the US.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Advanced degree and/or industry experience
  • Annotation experience
  • Experience with ontologies and label sets
  • Experience working remotely

items.content:
Telecom Business Consultant

Various
Anywhere
$100000 USD
Company: Crossover
Full Time

Overview

We’re running an Online Hiring Event this Saturday to hire Telecom Business Consultants ($100k/yr).

Online Hiring Events are live forums designed to enable you to understand the role and requirements through an interactive Q&A session followed by a self-directed testing process. The testing takes between 3-5 hours to complete. It’s worth taking the time to finish all the tests because we evaluate every single complete application to find the top talent.

This event will include all testing required to apply for the role. Upon grading the tests, and if you advance, we will set up an interview with the hiring manager.

The Telecom Consultant will work closely with the Chief Marketing Officer in advising Optiva’s more than 100 global mobile operators on key business issues such as acquisition, revenue, churn and cost.

He/she will be responsible for performing data analysis, preparing and presenting presentations and managing clients both independently and in a team setting.

We are looking for acquisition strategy, cross-sell up-sell, churn management, loyalty programs, revenue generation, Telecom Customer Segmentation, Tariff planning, Telecom Omni-Channel Strategist, Telecom Data/Cloud Play.

• You have experience working with Wireless Operators • You have a working knowledge of Customer Lifecycle Value • You are a fast learner, open to new challenges and new ways of doing things • You possess a strong intellectual curiosity • You excel in complex, fast-changing, unstructured environment • You are an excellent leader, negotiator, manager, and problem solver • You have experience as a Consultant for companies like BCG, McKinsey or Bain. • You have immediate availability

This role may be a great fit if







• You have no previous consulting experience • Your consulting experience is technical in nature (e.g., I.T., networking, etc..) • Your previous roles have primarily focused on sales or business development • You have no experience working with wireless carriers • You have no experience with business analysis tools and large data analysis

This role is NOT a fit and you should NOT apply if




Candidate Requirements:
  • 3-5 years of consulting experience with a proven track record
  • Experience with teams working in a global (remote) environment
  • Experience in enterprise software preferred, but not required
  • Ability to rapidly grasp new areas within the CMT domain and quickly structure a broader concept
  • Strong analytical skills and familiarity with business analysis tools (e.g. Tableau, SQL, excel, and the similar)
  • Strong undergraduate and/or graduate academic credentials preferred
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills
  • Fluency in English is a must
  • Project management experience is a nice to have
  • An MBA would be a significant plus

items.title: Nocturnist Telemedicine
items.content:
Nocturnist Telemedicine at Doctor on Demand

Remote

Medical Practice | Remote | Full-Time

JOB DESCRIPTION

Doctor On Demand is hiring for US Board Certified full-time Nocturnist employee positions across the country with specialty focus in Family Medicine, Emergency Medicine, Urgent Care and Internal Meds/Peds. Best-in-class EMR platform: User-friendly, web-based EMR platform built in-house by our Engineering Team which is highly rated by our physician staff. Start a conversation with us and learn how you can positively impact the lives of patients and play a role in improving healthcare.

Full-time:

  • Flexible overnight scheduling options
  • 401k, Benefits and CME resources
  • Full malpractice and tail coverage
  • Full service processing and coverage of cost for additional state licensure

About Doctor On Demand

Doctor On Demand is a nationwide healthcare service that provides video visits with board-certified physicians, psychiatrists and licensed psychologists via smartphones, tablets, and desktop computers. Patients download the Doctor On Demand app or visit www.doctorondemand.com, provide a list of their symptoms, and are connected for a video visit within minutes. Prescriptions, if needed, are sent directly to the pharmacy of choice. Doctor On Demand physicians can also order lab work, allowing for the treatment of a broader range of conditions and chronic care management.

Through its 5-star rated mobile application and website, consumers can access board-certified physicians in all 50 states and the District of Columbia with an average wait time of 5 minutes, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Doctor On Demand delivers services through employers, health plans, and directly to consumers. While insurance isn’t required, tens of millions of Americans enjoy covered medical and mental health visits.

Doctor On Demand is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Minneapolis and Washington, D.C.

items.title: Medical Coder, Claims Edit
items.content:
Medical Coder, Claims Edit at Signature Performance

Remote

Medical Coder / Claims Edit

Remote #678

POSTING LOCATION: Remote/Nationwide

Status: Full-time

Job Description

Out-Patient. Emergency, Ambulatory Surgery and Ancillary Services

WHAT YOU’LL DO: Responsible for assignment of accurate Evaluation and Management (E&M) codes, ICD-10 diagnoses, current procedural terminology (CPT) and Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS), modifiers and quantities derived from medical record documentation (paper or electronic) for outpatient , emergency, ambulatory surgery and ancillary service visits.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required knowledge and skills

  • Position requires excellent computer/communication skills for provider and staff interactions
  • Knowledge of anatomy/physiology and disease process, medical terminology, coding guidelines, documentation requirements, familiarity with medications and reimbursement guidelines
  • Candidate must have ability to handle multiple projects and appropriately prioritize tasks to meet deadlines
  • Candidate must have excellent organizational skills, able to understand and follow individual client Standard Operating Procedures
  • We are looking for 4 coders to fill this role:
  • 1. E/M profee
    2. ER facility side ICD10.
    3. OP clinic multispeciality providers
    4. Radiology ancillary (profee, IP, IVR, OP, ECG)

Education/Certification

Current AAPC or AHIMA coding certification required:

  • Registered Health Information Technologist (RHIT)
  • Registered Health Information Administrator (RHIA)
  • Certified Professional Coder (CPC)
  • Certified Coder Specialist – Physician (CCS-P)

Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA) and American Academy of Professional Coders (AAPC).

Continuing Education and Recertification: Required continuing education must be completed in accordance with AAPC or AHIMA requirements and certification maintained.

Signature Performance will assist.

Experience: a minimum of three years’ coding experience is required.

SPECIFIC TASKS

  • Responsible for assignment of accurate E&M, ICD-10, CPT and HCPCS codes and modifiers from medical record documentation
  • Identifies and abstracts information from medical records (paper or electronic) for special studies and audits, internal and external
  • Works within various client systems (Epic, McKesson, AllScripts, etc.), including applicable coding compliance editor software to ensure records are accurately coded
  • Follows established query process to clarify documentation to support coding assignments
  • May provide feedback to coders or physicians. Feedback will be presented in a supportive and educational manner
  • Works closely with the Coding and or QA Manager during QA audit process
  • Ensures all required component parts of the medical record that pertain to coding are present, accurate and comply with CMS, JCAHO and client requirements
  • Maintains productivity and accuracy requirements as outlined for each client. Unless otherwise stated, coding productivity follows AHIMA standards.

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
Charlotte, NC, USA
Burlington, VT, USA
Plattsburgh, NY, USA

EXPERIENCE: beginner

COMPANY: Reconciled; 1-10 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Cloud Applications
• Quickbooks
• Bookkeeping

Reconciled is an online bookkeeping and accounting service based in Burlington, VT. We use the latest in online accounting tools to serve small businesses in Vermont and around the country. If you are passionate about accounting and online tools, but also love helping entrepreneurs, startups and small businesses, then we want to hear from you!

We are looking to add a Bookkeeper who has a good understanding of accounting and is able to work from home/remotely (can be located anywhere in Vermont or Greater Charlotte, NC Area or Plattsburgh, NY Area). Bookkeeper must be comfortable with/learning Quickbooks Online. Bookkeeper must be professional, a self-starter, and be comfortable communicating with our business owner customers via e-mail and phone. Bookkeeper must be able to handle bookkeeping for multiple companies at a time using online accounting software. Bookkeeper must be available to work most of your hours between the normal business day (8am to 5pm) so that you can be responsive to customers requests, but some of your hours can be worked during the evening/weekends (optional). Bookkeeper must be comfortable with learning new online software and comfortable using technology in general, including video chat software, email, spreadsheets, Google apps, etc. Although this job is online/remote, you must be able to attend an in person 2 day staff meeting in Burlington, VT twice a year (travel and lodging paid for) and our bi-weekly online staff meeting.

Interested candidates must submit a resume AND cover letter. As well as a link to your LinkedIn profile if available.

Please also provide your desired hourly rate or salary.

Responsibilities and Duties

Bookkeeping using tools like QuickBooks Online and Bill.com, and Receiptbank.

Qualifications and Skills

Preferring someone have a few years of bookkeeping experience or at least an Associates in Accounting/Business or an Accounting Certificate with the desire to learn. Initial interviews will be conducted via video conference software (Zoom). Training on the online software is provided for all candidates.

Benefits

Medical, Dental, Vision and 401(k)

Junior NetSuite Technical Consultant

Job description

Job Description

Techfino LLC, a growing North American business and technology consulting firm and NetSuite Partner, is offering an exciting opportunity for a Junior NetSuite Technical Consultant interested in expanding their knowledge and expertise at a quickly growing and successful company.

At Techfino, we help our clients to grow their business by improving operational efficiency and reducing IT costs using cloud-based technology.  We provide customization, support, and implementation services for industry leading cloud solutions such as NetSuite and Amazon Web Services (AWS).

We are seeking a bright JavaScript developer who will work closely with management to develop their scripting expertise and learn the standards of SuiteScript to best serve our clients. You will be expected to prioritize needs, resolve conflicts, and develop high quality solutions. You will interface directly with clients and be given additional responsibility as you progress in your career. Tons of opportunity for career advancement, on the job training, and exposure to all aspects of business.

This is a full-time position offering the flexibility to work from home, with some travel required based on project and client needs. Candidate must be a citizen of either the United States or Canada.

Skills & Requirements

Necessary Qualifications

  • A Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field.
  • 1 year of experience writing and maintaining web applications, both front-end (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) and back-end (server-side).
  • 2 years of experience building web applications using HTML 5/CSS 3/JavaScript. We require a candidate with strong JavaScript knowledge.
  • Knowledge of object oriented programming and various software architectures and API standards.
  • Excellent writing and communication skills. A strong command of the English language and the ability to communicate clearly and effectively are critical.
  • Ability to work and travel in the United States
  • Travel may be required up to 80% based on the needs/request of the client.

Key Personal Characteristics

  • Must be passionate about coding and a self-starter requiring minimum supervision.
  • Excellent ability to interface with clients.
  • Exemplary problem-solving and requirement-gathering skills.
  • Looking for a well-rounded professional, not "just a developer" - our developer's interface with business professionals and may be exposed to other aspects of our business.
  • Takes ownership and responsibility for one’s own work and professional career development.
  • Willingness to learn and apply company’s best practices and coding standards.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with NetSuite and SuiteScript
  • NetSuite certification
  • Prior ERP experience or an interest in solving business problems

Compensation and Benefits for US Only

  • Salary & Bonus Based on Experience
  • Health, Vision and Dental Benefits Available
  • Excellent Company Retirement Plan (401(k) + 4% match)
  • Career Development Assistance (Mentor Program)
  • Paid Time Off for 18 days per year

About Techfino LLC

At Techfino we empower businesses to succeed by providing the highest operational excellence, technical superiority, and passion for our work. By combining this passion, team spirit, and hard work with NetSuite’s flexible platform, we make business, technology, and people’s needs a reality.

Techfino is a specialized consultancy and development group with proven experience designing, building, and maintaining NetSuite applications. Our highly skilled team of experts leverages best practices to gather and understand core business requirements and to implement NetSuite ERP, CRM, and e-commerce solutions for our clients.

Apply now

Remote | Freelance

VIRTUAL ASSISTANT

Want to enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the leading virtual assistant provider in the United States? BELAY is a top-ranked virtual solutions company looking for highly-motivated virtual assistants, who have a passion for serving others. Come join us and experience the freedom of working virtually with the ideal work/life balance to match your professional pursuit.

WHY BELAY?

  • Entrepreneur Magazine ranked BELAY the number one in Best Culture for Small-Sized Companies and the Top Company Culture for a Small Business Award for having a “productive” and “high-performance” culture
  • Recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the Fastest Growing Companies in the United States in 2015
  • Received the ‘When Work Works’ Award from the Society of Human Resource Management, recognizing “companies that offer effective and flexible workplace strategies, empowering their organization to rise above the competition.”
  • Atlanta Business Chronicle (BELAY’s headquarters) named BELAY one of the “Best Places to Work”

ARE YOU LOOKING FOR:

  • A remote position where you serve as your client’s indispensable partner?
  • An opportunity to use your talents and skills to build your client’s success?
  • A community of contractors to share ideas and best practices?
  • Regular support and guidance from your BELAY team?

Essential Functions/Responsibilities:

  • Maintain executive’s appointments/calendar
  • Email management and organization
  • Prepare presentations and/or spreadsheets
  • Social Media management
  • Create structure/workflow/processes
  • Research technologies and make recommendations
  • CRM administration: updates and data entry
  • Make travel arrangements, such as booking flights, cars, and making hotel and restaurant reservations.
  • Event planning and coordination
  • Project Assistance/Coordination

Key Attributes:

  • Detail-oriented, organized and efficient
  • Extremely self-motivated with strong time management
  • Proactive, pragmatic, and resourceful problem solver
  • Trustworthy and reliable
  • Friendly and professional communicator
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet or beat deadlines with no errors
  • Tech Savvy and quick to learn new concepts
  • Ability to anticipate the needs of others coupled with a strong desire to serve
  • Adaptable

Key Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree and experience working remotely preferred
  • Available daily (Mon-Fri) during business hours, and able to dedicate at least 20 hour/week
  • At least five years’ experience in an administrative support role
  • In-home office setup including: Mac or PC Computer (including webcam) with minimum 1.0ghz dual core processor, 8gb, and the most recent version of MS Office installed (all programs; Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)

  • Designated professional, quiet space

NOTE:

  • This is a 1099 Contractor Role

items.title: Financial Controller
items.content:
Financial Controller

Location: Remote San Francisco
Role and job type: Executive Full-time

Job Description

A rapidly growing international FinTech company, that is creating an innovative product for insuring deposits of digital currencies and assets, is seeking a Financial Controller. As the Financial Controller, reporting to the CEO, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of financial management, including risk management, and financial and regulatory reporting. You will work alongside senior management to make sure that key financial risks are managed and controlled.

  • You will manage finance operations including managing the liabilities on our books, cashflow, and reporting.
  • You will ensure that we are meeting all necessary regulatory compliance requirements.
  • Key to your success in the role will be developing and documenting business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls.
  • You will ensure quality control over financial transactions and financial reporting.
  • You will provide advice to other members of the management team on financial management and financial control matters as required.

What you’ll need:

  • You possess proven experience in a Financial Controller or equivalent position, with experience in Financial Services, Banking or FinTech advantageous.
  • You possess thorough knowledge of accounting principles and procedures, with experience working under IFRS and preparing full financial statements under IFRS.
  • You possess experience with regulation, especially as applied to insurance products and services.
  • You have excellent reporting skills and high levels of proficiency with Microsoft products and account software.
  • You have excellent written and spoken communication skills with the ability to explain complex accounting and finance matters to other stakeholders and teams in a clear and concise way.
  • You possess strong prioritising skills and the ability to multi-task, work under pressure and adapt to changing priorities.
  • Proactive, results-driven, able to work on your own initiative and with strong attention to detail are all ways in which you would describe yourself.
  • You are driven, aspirational and possess a desire for career development and growth within an entrepreneurial new business environment.
  • A passion and interest in blockchain and cryptocurrency.

Salary range

$60-120k plus equity

items.title: Pivot Auditor
items.content:
Pivot Auditor at Overland Solutions

Remote

With employees in all 50 states, Overland Solutions, Inc. (OSI) is the nation’s largest, and leading, provider of Premium Audit and Insurance Inspection services. Insurance companies outsource these services, and for 75 years, they have counted on the expertise of OSI employees to ensure that they are charging the correct premium to their customers.

Responsibilities

As a Premium Pivot Auditor, you will complete audits for Property & Casualty insurance policies-Worker’s compensation and General Liability. You will work directly with the policyholder or their contact, over the phone, to obtain payroll and other accounting record information, along with information to properly evaluate and apply correct classifications and exposure amounts for these policies. All assignments are provided to you by your manager through our state of the art Web based production system, OSI Trac.

Benefits for eligible employees include:

  • Full Benefit package (Full Time employee only) including vacation and paid holidays
  • Extensive paid training
  • Compensation consists of a base hourly rate with additional production incentives

Qualifications

Please apply if you meet these qualifications:

  • Must have premium auditor experience, preferable 2 years or more
  • Have Insurance, Accounting/Bookkeeping, Payroll or other related work experience
  • Have an associates or bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Accounting, Finance, Business or Bookkeeping
  • Experience working directly with the public, preferably on the phones
  • Self-starter and able to work with minimal supervision
  • Well organized
  • Great customer service skills and the ability to communicate both written and orally
  • Strong organization and time management skills
Apply for job

items.title: Economics Author
items.content:
Economics Author at Macmillan Learning

Remote | Freelance

This position will be employed through Headway consulting firm working remotely throughout the US.

Requirements

Macmillan Learning is moving to a new online homework system, and the Economics Author will be a key player in the transition. The Economics Author will learn the new online authoring system and help convert existing material to the new system, as well as creating new questions as needed. All these questions must have targeted feedback and full solutions designed to improve the learning process for our students. The primary texts we will be working are principles and intermediate micro and macro, but there will be other upper level courses in the future.

Major Responsibilities:

  • Edit converted questions and make sure they function properly.
  • Authoring hints and feedback that anticipate common student errors, provide insightful diagnosis of their misconceptions, and coach them toward mastering the material.
  • Creating solutions to these questions that are complete and concise.
  • Authoring new material as needed to round out the question bank.

Required Skills / Knowledge:

  • Strong knowledge base in Economics
  • Experience teaching higher ed Principles of Economics
  • Desire to see students learn and succeed in their roles as students
  • Experience writing original homework and/or test questions
  • Ability to improve questions through the editing process
  • Strong computer skills including the ability to quickly learn new products and technology

Location: Remote

Experience Needed:

  • Experience teaching higher ed economics and writing original homework and/or test questions.
  • Strong computer skills and the ability to learn new systems quickly

Educational Background Required:

  • MS or MA in Economics,PhD in progress will be considered
Apply for job
